events.name: Volunteer for Maker Faire Pre-BuildUp 2016!
events.description:
Ever wanted to be a Sith Lord, Spiderman or a Human Hamster?

Singapore Makers Assocation (SGMA) is a community platform for Makers to celebrate creativity and inventiveness in Singapore. This year, SGMA is inviting you to let loose your imagination, curiosities and join us for the building process for Maker Faire 2016!

Here are our show-stopper projects for Maker Faire 2016:
1) Team Hamster Wheel - to build a life-sized wooden  Human Hamster Wheel powered by humans!
2) Team Plastic - Inspired by the folks behind Precious Plastic, this team is building a plastic injection machine that melts little plastic pellets to mould!
3) Team Blacksmith -  to build a forge setup to bring blacksmithing to the masses
4) Team Hovercraft - make a DIY hovercraft!
5) Team Brollie - to make a series of not-so-shady smart umbrellas activated by human interaction
6) Team Candy Floss - think Spiderman, but with cotton candy! These guys are making a cotton candy spray contraption
7) Team Hologram - I sense a disturbance in the force - these guys are playing with hologramic projections and DIY setups!

You can also look forward to our jaw-dropping Dangerous Demos again this year with many surprises in store!

If you would like to join in the community effort to put up these exhibits, Sign up at http://goo.gl/forms/XAvKjXQmqN⁠⁠⁠⁠ till June 19!

Powered by OneMaker Group, a unique consortium comprising of the key players of the Maker Movement in Singapore and operator of makerspaces across Singapore, including the Prototyping Lab@National Design Centre.
events.location: OneMaker Group - OMG, 111 Middle Road, #01-02, National Design Centre, Singapore 188969

events.name: IoT prototype for education - demonstrate how we can build smart building
events.description: What Smart Nation means to the property market? According to the website of the Prime Minister’s Office, “Singapore strives to be a Smart Nation, in which our people are empowered by technology to lead meaningful and fulfilled lives ... Government agencies facilitate this by sharing extensive real-time data in the public domain. This way, anyone can access the data resources and participate in generating solutions to real challenges.” Smart Nation sounds good, but what does it really mean to business and opportunities? This meetup will share the IoT prototype in education - demonstrate how easy we could use this prototype to build smart building and business opportunities for Home Care Services or Education ....
events.location: Technopreneur Circle, #05-03 Raffles City Tower, 250 North Bridge Road Singapore 179101
